data.title: Daniel J. Goldbach, DO
data.meta_description: Dr. Daniel Goldbach received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton in Dayton, Ohio in 2012. He then went on to receive his medical degree from the Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine in Erie, Pennsylvania in 2016. His postgraduate training brought him to Columbus, Ohio where he completed his residency in Internal Medicine and fellowship in Cardiovascular Disease at OhioHealth Doctors Hospital in 2019. Dr. Goldbach is board certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine, National Board of Echocardiography, and the National Board of Clinical Lipidology. His focus is on preventive cardiovascular disease and the management of complex lipid disorders. He is highly motivated to serve the needs of his new community and enjoys listening to and caring for his patients. Dr. Goldbach was born in Orangeburg, South Carolina where he lived shortly before spending much of his childhood in Cincinnati, Ohio. He enjoys biking, kayaking, wood working, and spending time outdoors with his wife and their two dogs.
data.text:
Bio

Dr. Daniel Goldbach received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton in Dayton, Ohio in 2012. He then went on to receive his medical degree from the Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine in Erie, Pennsylvania in 2016. His postgraduate training brought him to Columbus, Ohio where he completed his residency in Internal Medicine and fellowship in Cardiovascular Disease at OhioHealth Doctors Hospital in 2019. Dr. Goldbach is board certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine, National Board of Echocardiography, and the National Board of Clinical Lipidology. His focus is on preventive cardiovascular disease and the management of complex lipid disorders. He is highly motivated to serve the needs of his new community and enjoys listening to and caring for his patients. Dr. Goldbach was born in Orangeburg, South Carolina where he lived shortly before spending much of his childhood in Cincinnati, Ohio. He enjoys biking, kayaking, wood working, and spending time outdoors with his wife and their two dogs.

Practice

Roper St. Francis Physician Partners Coastal Cardiology
